Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: EmmaKL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Very central and an easy walk everywhere you want to go. And it's between two train stations so getting to and from the airport, or even around town is simple as well. Rooms are small and basic but clean, and modern in their decoration. The bathroom was good, and clean too. The staff were friendly but I didn't need too much assistance. My room was right behind the coffee & vending machine where the staff congregate in the morning which was loud (even with ear plugs) so I'd suggest you ask for a different room. That said, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hostel!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa F
Reviews.Content: This hostel is fantastic, more like a hotel than any other hostel I've stayed in! The location is very central, withing walking distance to all the major attractions and shops. If you'd rather get the train there are several metro stations close by as well. The room was clean and bright, the bathroom was big and housekeeping did a great job everyday. The standout was definitely Alex, one of the staff members. He was friendly, always willing to suggest things to do and answer any questions. He also helped us purchase football tickets online as the page was in Spanish and we couldn't understand a word! If you are traveling alone, be warned: there is no common room or kitchen so it is extremely hard to meet other travellers. Also, breakfast is pre-packaged sugary snacks but there are so many good places to eat in Madrid that it wasn't a big issue. Overall, we loved this place and definitely recommend staying at Hostal Gala

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, slightly noisy, average air con”
Reviews.Author: Mark J
Reviews.Content: This isnt really a hostal more of a good hotel. Right in the center of madrid, 2 mins from the tube station and 5 mins from most of the main streets and areas. The hostal is located on the second floor of an old style house and has around 30 rooms. The rooms are above average in terms of size and the bathroom is excellent with a good power shower. The free Wifi in the hotel also worked very well The only issue with this hotel is the noise from the main hallway is quite loud especially when people are checking in and out of the hotel in the morning. Also the aircon is not the greatest however just about does the job, whilst I was there the weather was around 40 degrees yet still managed to sleep fine. The staff are extremely helpful especially the lady on reception, one of the most helpful reception staff I have met. Would definitely return and would recommend to anyone who want somewhere to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stacey R
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how helpful and friendly the staff were. One staffer went above and beyond for us on more than one occasion, which we certainly appreciated. The hotel is well located, modern and clean, and the room was serviced daily. The downsides are that hotel is not sound-proof at all, and the wireless internet did not extend to our room. If you are a light sleeper and adverse to ear plugs, this is not the place for you. The street noise was not as bad as the noise carry-over from the common room and other guest rooms - someone had a nasty cough that kept us up the first night. Then we bought ear plugs. As far as cleanliness, quality of staff and location go, I think this hotel would be hard to beat in the budget accommodation category. I have had few better experiences in the budget hotel category in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, even in the Summer”
Reviews.Author: Treepham
Reviews.Content: This place is hidden amongst the architecture along a narrow st. Yet, once inside there is a genuine sense of invitation. You can visibly tell that a lot of effort has been made to make it welcoming, from the nice aromas, decor to washing and ironing services (at cost). I would base my recommendation of hostal gala on its exciting location, and comfortable sleep. A place that has free wifi is always a personal plus for me, but I think its hospitality is demonstrable of how friendly everyone was in madrid. All in all, the experience rivals in our best.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid's very best kept secret - excellent location and good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: DragonSilver
Reviews.Content: We're a family of four and so we booked the family room with one double bed and two single beds. We were not impressed with the front door, intercom system nor the lift but when we arrived on level 2 it was a different matter. The hostal is nicely decorated and very welcoming. The room contained all the expected necessities and its size was good and very well kept and clean. A rather small bathroom but the shower was brilliant. We had two balconies and one window and we were worried that the noise from traffic and nightlife outside would not allow us to sleep. This was note the case, each of the exterior apertures are equipped with very good quality double glazing. They are not 100% sound proof but we were not disturbed during our sleep.The walls between the rooms are paper thin and this was more of a concern! It was very hot during our stay and the room temperature was always comfortable so no complaints regarding air-conditioning either. In terms of facilities, the rooms do not have a fridge or a microwave but receptionist offered to keep our items in their fridge whenever required. They also confirmed that they could heat our items using their microwave whenever we needed. They were also kind enough to provide us with an electric kettle so that we could prepare some tea in our room, in the morning. Other members mentioned the coffee machine and cold water/soft drinks vending machines in the hallway. We also found these to be very convenient. Hotel also provides some free supermarket type , plastic wrapped cakes, pastries on the high table for guests every morning, which is a nice gesture, we thought. WIFI worked well from our room. The staff at Hostal Gala are very friendly and english speaking. Always willingly helping us out and recommending some very good places to visit. They provided us with accurate directions and some good ideas and tips to make our holiday a memorable one. The location of this little gem is probably the main key advantage. It is conveniently located in the very centre close to all the main attractions as well as the Callao, Santo Domingo and Opera Metro stations. We used to walk Puerto Del Sol square and get there within 5 minutes and Plaza Mayor within 10 minutes. There are some decent restaurants in the vicinity too. We are not fans of the 'all you can eat' type but there is a restaurant called Topolino just across the road offering good all you can eat menus, at just Eur 8.95 per person during weekdays. Kids loved it because they could have both Pizza and Paella! We were very happy with our choice of accommodation in Madrid. Hostal Gala satisfied our requirement and we highly recommend it! Try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Liv70
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendlier than most in hotels we stayed in during our trip through Spain (we stayed in all categories of hotels - from hostels to 5-star hotels). They spoke good English as well, which was very helpful since my Spanish is barely adequate. The location is good, within 10-20 minutes walking distance of everything you'd like to see in Madrid. There is a coffee machine in the lobby/hallway, which is convenient considering the fact that nothing opens early in Madrid. So if you're an early riser, you will appreciate that. There is also a free wifi. While the rooms had no fridge, the staff will store anything you need in their fridge. Rooms are small even by European standards. While conveniently located in close proximity to all major sights, it is on the street full of night bars and prostitutes, so it was very unpleasant walking back to the hostel late at night. I haven't read that in any of the reviews anywhere before booking, but I wouldn't have booked it for sure. Although the public garage is relatively close to the hotel, there is no space to leave the car to unload the luggage. We have circled around for over an hour, until we were able to park briefly and unload the luggage Good value for the money though!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: gadukette
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location and great staff. The place is clean and stylish for the money in Madrid. My onl complaints are that it is very noisy at night from within the hotel and the AC in my single room was non existent. Between the hot room and the noise, I did not get a good nights sleep which prevented me from booking this hotel again in the second half of my Spain trip.

Reviews.Title: “stylish and cosy in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: RexTsatsaroglou
Reviews.Content: Best value for money accommodation I've ever had in Madrid. Located in a building at the end of the pedestrian shopping street Preciados, next to Metro station Santo Domingo, on the 2nd (reception, rooms) and 3rd floor (apartments). Black-and-white minimal design, comfortable modern rooms with bathroom, and the biggest plus: friendliest and most competent reception ever, that makes you feel at home. Only drawback: central A/C on 2nd floor seemed unable to cope with the heatwave of nearly 40 degrees that had hit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Loved My (Second) Room + Staff Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Madrid. Hostal Gala has really CUTE rooms (if you have one with a window facing the front, so be sure to ask for that. I first had a room in the back facing a light well and it was depressing. But they moved me the next day and really took care of me. The desk clerks are SUPER FRIENDLY, all speak PERFECT ENGLISH, and know the city well. Irene was especially awesome. The location was convenient, close to three or four metro stations all within a block or two away. The room facing out was light and bright and very clean (except for a bit of mold near the shower). The rooms all have private bath and air conditioning (but it does take a few hours for the room to cool down). I especially liked the gauzy curtains I could close but still let light in, and the room was very well INSULATED FROM NOISE from the street. I slept really well. The only big negative for me was NOISE from inside the hotel. Sound really carries along the long hallway of the hostal along all the rooms, and when people check in you can hear everything they say. But I do RECOMMEND this place. For $80 a night in summer in Madrid? Really, really good.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal gala has a special place in my heart”
Reviews.Author: RoseVelvet14
Reviews.Content: I stayed there only for a night in august 2011 as I landed in Madrid by myself before my friends got there. I was very worried since i was a solo female traveller but it turned out the be a great experience! The place is clean and modern, it looks just like the pictures no joke!! The staff was super nice, gave me lots of tips and I guess they could tell I was nervous because they came to check up on me twice :) Location is convenient as well, lots of cafes and restaurant around the hostel. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accom”
Reviews.Author: JordanMcDoogle
Reviews.Content: We had a large double room, plenty of space. Our room looked just like the photos, first time that has happened to us. Brilliant location, easy walking to major attractions. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Barbara W
Reviews.Content: This is a great place with really helpful staff and good rooms and comfy beds. It is a perfect location to explore the city The 24 hr reception is great and useful for early morning flights. It also has a lift which many hostels don't . A great place. Small con is the the air conditioning is not fantastic but works enough to cool room a bit

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: carrymat
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location with very friendly staff. The apartments are great value and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: We had reservations about booking a hostal but it was nicer than most hotels we’ve stayed at! Perfect location (just off gran via and 5 minutes walk to Sol), beautiful spacious and clean room, powerful shower and impeccable customer service - very friendly and helpful staff and i got a free bottle of champagne on my birthday. We’d recommend anyone going to Madrid to stay at Hostal Gala!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gracerk
Reviews.Content: I used TripAdvisor to select this hotel for our two nights in Madrid and I'm so glad I did. The reviews were very helpful and when we got to the hotel I actually thought that the reviews did not do it justice as far as the location goes. This hotel is within walking distance of everything we wanted to see during our short stay! Not only could we walk to see the Royal Palace, but we could walk to the Prado Museum and to the Reina Sophia Museum that houses Picasso's "Guernica." It's also a short walk to Plaza Major and La Puerta del Sol. The staff were always friendly and smiling eager to help if we needed anything. The rooms don't come with a hairdryer but we asked for one and got it promptly. They also offered us a laptop to use in our room - along with free Wifi access so we could check our emails. A special bonus in the opinions of my husband and myself was the location of a great grocery store in the lower level of the El Cortes Ingles department store just one block away. We like to stock up on beverages, fruit, cheese, etc. for picnic-style meals that allow us more time for sight-seeing and less time spent sitting in restaurants waiting for service. One final note - if you do use the metro use the Santo Domingo stop for this hotel as it is literally across the street and down the hil about 2 buildings. We took the bus from the airport to the Atocha train station where we got on the metro to head to the hotel. The train station is within walking distance but we didn't want to lug our bags that distance so we hopped on the metro and just couldn'd believe how close the hotel was to the stop when we got off. We were sure we'd have to walk a few blocks but it was no more than a half block from the metro steps. We'd stay there again if we were to return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Tigersfan
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location - right next to a Metro station, just round the corner from Opera and five minutes from the Royal Palace. Loads of restaurants, bars and cafes locally. We booked the five-bed apartment - perfect for a family or group of friends, with room to relax and a fully-equipped kitchen. Really good value for a capital city. A wee bit noisy if you're not used to city centres.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, central, clean”
Reviews.Author: Angela R
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent low budget hotel in a great location. Our room was clean, comfortable and well designed we also had a little balcony overlooking a square. The bathroom looked new, clean and had a great shower. All the staff were friendly and helpful and when we needed an extra bed quite late in the evening the receptionist was very helpful and pleasant about setting it up for us and making sure we were all comfortable and happy. The hotel doesn't offer breakfast but they have a coffee machine and snacks in the common area and can also recommend some places to eat. The only negative was that the walls were a bit thin so it got a bit noisy at times but overall the quality, location and price of this hotel made it a great base for exploring Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “a bit expensive but great room&location!”
Reviews.Author: miss_rafter
Reviews.Content: Just 5 mins walk to Sol. LIFT!!! LIFT!! LIFT!! Opposite hostal a lot of cafes n restaurante. Best for muslims as few HALAL rest just rite in front of the hostal! (4 may be) I love the room n SHOWER especially!! Even 4 star hotel dont even have that kind of shower/bathroom. but to be honest a bit expensive compared to other hostals n the one i stayed before. But off course the location, Gala is the closest to Sol. Tips; if u guys arriving with metro, just go down at SOL station n drag your bag, still less than 10 mins. easier instead of changing your metro to the other line n to get down at St Domingo (SD). Tho the SD station right in front of Gala, but the hassle to get to the other line/ platforms with no lift! and even to get out frm SD. Unless u dont have any suitcases! But still if u dont have any baggage, better to walk from SOL, believe me!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean place”
Reviews.Author: Unknown66
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and they had the BEST showers. Staff were helpful, supplied hairdryers etc when I asked. The only problem was they stuffed up our booking and gave us a triple room instead of a double which is what we asked for. But apart from that the hostel itself is quite nice and modern inside. There is no kitchen however.

Reviews.Title: “I love it”
Reviews.Author: drql
Reviews.Content: I got a single room. The room is small but enough for solo. Bed is very comfy. I had my own bathroom which was important to me. Rain shower in the bathroom. What else would you ask for after a whole day in Prado or Reina Sofia? The location is super. It's one street across the metro station and later I realized it's walking distance to all those sites. Walking one or two blocks and you would be on Gran Via. Staff was very friendly and nice. They told me how to take the metro to the airport, which can be a little tricky. There is no phone in the room but if you need a wake up call they would come to knock at your door in the morning. I guess the walls are really thin since I could hear the girls next door giggling. But the staff tried to tell them to be quiet. I bought my earplugs so my neighbors did not bother me too much.

Reviews.Title: “Central, quiet, cozy & affordable.”
Reviews.Author: SusanLinley
Reviews.Content: Hostal Gala is a little trendy with its black and white interior, but look past that and you'll find an economical, quiet, clean adorable hostal. We had a room with a balcony, looking out on the plaza and LOVED it. We stayed 5 nights and were super happy the entire time. If you leave your window open - expect to hear the after bar crowd, but if you're one of them... no worries. Free Wi-fi. Private bathrooms en suite. Smallish - euro-sized rooms, but we found it totally comfortable for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Very good in every way”
Reviews.Author: Demeter_Izm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in a triple room at Hostal Gala Madrid last May. The location was perfect, very close (less than a minute walk) to the metro station and right in the city centre. Our room was not very big but there was enoguh space for three people at the same time. We got everything what we expected: Modern decoration, clean room and bathroom, spotless sheets, free wifi, very reasonable price. Thin walls might be a problem for light sleepers but we were so exhausted to hear. We felt safe and stayed comfortable in Hostal Gala. Special thanks to front desk, especially Irene, who answered all our questions with patience.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: DS646
Reviews.Content: For a Saturday night in Madrid, you're not going to find a better deal in as good of a location. Great beds. Great shower. But very small rooms. And the walls are like tissue paper (and that might be an understatement).

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ohmiso
Reviews.Content: Modern, decent-sized room and great location. Overall Hostal Gala is excellent value and we would stay again. The wifi was terrible although we were sometimes able to use the free wifi provided by the city as we overlooked the square/park next to the hotel. That's the only reason I'm bumping it down from a five as I deliberately chose somewhere with wifi. The staff were very helpful. On check-in we were given a map and directions to the major sites which are all very easy to get to from the hostal. They're within walking distance or, if you're note feeling very energetic, within a very short distance on the metro. There are no communal laundry facilities, so there is a fee involved in getting you clothes washed (though it is much more affordable than standard hotel rates, it may be a problem for travellers on a tight budget). One of my tops was not returned with the rest of our washing however they were happy to mail it to Australia to return it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea S
Reviews.Content: Could not recommend this place more - fantastic location central to everything you want to see and do in Madrid, attentive and helpful staff and immaculate rooms. Right near Sol and Opera subway stops. Stayed in a room with two singles (king size singles, very comfy) and offered plenty of space. Rooms are cleaned daily and the cleaning staff go above and beyond. Staff at the desk are so helpful and go the extra mile to make sure you have a great stay - we even got given a bottle of champagne when they found out it was one of our birthdays. If you are not used to sleeping in the city I would suggest bringing ear plugs, no need for eye masks as room offers shutters and doors that blog out the sun. Like many have said before, it is just like staying in a hotel. While WiFi is available it can be slow and unreliable at times. If you go to Madrid stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, nice enough”
Reviews.Author: melb20
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location, right next to a lively plaza and a two minute walk to Plaza Mayor and a really nice market. Room was clean with modern decor (sort of ikea style). Bathroom was really good, had a nice shower with all these weird different settings. Daily housekeeping and comfy beds, if not a little hard. Staff were helpful with getting to the airport and providing maps. Pretty sure all rooms have a balcony. Cons: The walls were quite thin so you could hear room-to-room, overheard people fighting early in the morning. Woke me up a couple of times. There was no communal kitchen or common room either, but wasn't such an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 254fam
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (2 young kids). We rented the apartment for 3 nights. Having a small kitchen and laundry was a nice bonus for a place that was not too expensive. Also having the space to spread out a bit after staying in some smaller properties in Europe was nice. The property is in a fabulous location just off a metro stop and in walking distance to several metro stops and plenty of things to do. Very safe area too. The apartment was very clean and decorated nicely (nothing fancy but well done). Staff was very nice and helpful. They offer free tours of Madrid; unfortunately we never took advantage of that but nice to know it was available. We were in Madrid when it was very hot...we had 2 ac units (one for living area where kids slept) and one in main bedroom. This was very nice! Wifi did not work well in the apartment...we found one spot where we could access it. They had good black out shades which came in handy with the sun setting so late in the summer and having young kids. Our only issue was they were remodeling an apartment right next door. So there was quite a bit of noise. During the day, we did not mind b/c we were out exploring but one night they were working pretty late. As soon as we told reception, it did stop.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean, good location and happy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: u12mjw
Reviews.Content: This is a great little property. Friends I was with found the rooms to be quite hot as the air conditioning wasnt up to much however they supplied a fan and were really keen to get the problem sorted. The property is clean and the decorations and beds are fantastic for this end of the market. I liked that it was kind of a secret door to get in...which was a bit weird on the day we turned up but just push the buzzer, walk up the stairs like some cold war secret agent and you're in! Overall very nice - presumably you are staying in hostels because you dont expect room service and flowers so you will be well impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: AmandaSuzuki
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hostal Gala with my sister, in the end of our one month trip around Spain. It's was a lovely surprise! The room was a little bit small, but nicely decorated with VERY comfortable beds, and a tiny but cute bathroom. The room had two large beds, with a soft and warm quilt, a wardrobe with room enough to fit our stuff and a little balcony. The location ws excelent, really close to the subway, and next to Gran Via (one of the main avenues in Madrid). The only thing that missed to me was a kitchen, where we could prepare a fast meal. The staff was really nice to us! I would definitely stay there again. It's a good option from people who are sick of staying in so so hostel, after travelling for while.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sms6778
Reviews.Content: Perfect location near two subway stations, but really walked everywhere. Clean and well decorated rooms (Ikea style with some nice details), and bathroom with all the essentials plus great shower. Well received by frontdesk staff, always with a smile every morning.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aschnepf
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good about this place... Excellent location with easy access to the metro and in walking distance to the downtown attractions. The staff at the front desk was helpful and courteous. Our room was clean, well decorated and comfortable---and the shower was phenomenal! We had a small balcony, with great noise protection when the door was shut. The room wasn't spacious, but as good as they come for a hostel, really. I will be staying here again whenever I make it back that way...

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: wally359
Reviews.Content: Really really nice staff, incredibly helpful too. Great location to the Metro although the area is a little business-district like. Sound-proofing was unfortunately really terrible - I bought ear-plugs after my first night there. Overall the place was ok. We had what seemed to be one of the less attractive rooms in the place - windows that wouldn't open and over-looking the air-con units of the building next door, the place was like a little prison cell! I know I shouldn't get sucked-in by the photos on the website, but it is annoying that you book a double room with this place and the photo that pops up alongside what you are booking is massively different to what you end up with

Reviews.Title: “Charming hostal in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay R
Reviews.Content: If you look at pictures of this hotel, you will understand it's appeal. Very classy and modern. The room was small but no smaller than other European hotels. The shower was awesome, loved the fancy massager shower head! The location was also fantastic. Plenty of restaurants/cafes in the area and less than five minutes from Gran Via. I highly recommend the hop on/hop off bus (tickets can be purchased at the hostal) if only for transportation. I love walking but it's a big city. I did the whole bus tour once to get the narration and a feel for the city. Then I went to areas I wanted to see again or eat near and travelled via the bus. Great shopping on Gran Via and great restaurants. Lots of shows in the area too. Very busy city so there was some noise throughout the night but nothing terrible. The staff were all very helpful. Loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, a great budget option”
Reviews.Author: PandoraBehr
Reviews.Content: I loved my three nights here. As other reviews state, this is a hostal, not a hotel. The rooms are wonderfully, but basically decorated. Saying this, I had the BEST shower I've ever had in a hotel here - it was wonderful. The location is fabulous, the staff friendly and the daily linen change welcome. The downside is that as every other review has mentioned, the walls are thin and it can get noisy - especially on Saturday night when the nearby club rocks on until dawn. I had room 221 jsut behind reception and could hear most things easily through the walls. Though not a place for light sleepers, I had no trouble (and had earplugs just in case). The free working WIFI was an added bonus - and really fast too. This is a great budget option.

Reviews.Title: “perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Iuliana31
Reviews.Content: I have chosen this hostal based on price and location, and hoping that the picture of the rooms are closer to reality than other hotels I have been to. The nice surprise was that the rooms looks exactly like the pictures. Nice decorated rooms, modern, clean. On the other hand the walls are thin, and with very comunicative neighbours, you can have some troubles with your sleep. Me personally, I did not have any issue with that. The location is really good, close to all important things to be seen in Madrid. i would recomed this place to all my friends, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hostal and very good location”
Reviews.Author: ib-phix
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hostal for 2 days. We had a room on the street but double glazing windows were very helpful against the possible noise from the street. However, the hallway side of the room was more noisy. The hostal has a simple design (with some IKEA furniture - but this is very common in Madrid hostals). The bathroom has a comfortable shower). The people from the hostal are very nice and helpful. There are vendor machines for reasonably priced cold and hot drinks and a free wifi access. No breakfast is available. The location is very good too. It is at walking distance from the shopping streets (Preciados and Puerta del Sol), Royal Palace and Plaza de España, Plaza Mayor and La Latina tapas area, the new San Miguel Market and it also close to Chueca. A very good option in the centre of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel-like hostel, modern and nicely decorated rooms, clean, nice views from large windows. Good bathrooms. Very friendly and helpful staff. No charge for wireless. It is on the third floor of an old appartment house right on Plaza Santa Domingo. Perfect starting point for walking tours and tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic budget accomodation in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ACSydney
Reviews.Content: What a little gem. This is a well decorated new hostel which is right in the heart of Madrid. The lady who runs the hostel is delightful as well as her staff. The rooms are more hotel like having wireless internet, television, daily sheet change, linen etc. I would highly recommend for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Unique room near the action of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MrTeachCP
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for three and this room provided three single beds. The room was fairly spacious and the bathroom was great, but some of the other details were lacking. The beds were very hard, and the air conditioner vent was in the entrance and never seemed to get air to the back of the room. Any noise in the halls was easily heard and there was some street noise as well. Many faults can be overlooked when you have a helpful staff, and the staff at the Gala was very friendly and helpful. They helped with reservations to the airport and always greeted us with a smile when we came in. The hostel is just a few blocks from the Gan Via and it is easy to walk to many of the attractions of the center of Madrid. There are a couple of subway stations nearby so travel is easy. The hostel is on the third floor of the building, and can be a bit hard to find initially.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel -great location!”
Reviews.Author: Shimmerstars
Reviews.Content: It was fantastic experience at Hostal Gala Madrid. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were modern and very clean! Love the decor! My friend and I especially love the shower - its soo funky and pressure system is great! The location is very convenient - within walking distance to all major attractions! The closest metro stop Santa Domingo ( take Plaza Santa Domingo exit and its only 1 minute walk! Callao is only 3 mins walk away! It is impossible to get lost in Madrid - its soo easy to walk around. The hotel is located on the 2nd floor so there are a few flights of stairs to walk up but its nothing to worry about. easy walk. You get 3 sets of keys. 1 for the front door, 1 for the door to the hotel and 1 for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: willemsk
Reviews.Content: We loved this hostal! The location was great - just remember when you are exiting the metro at Santo Domingo to take the Plz. Santo Domingo exit and you are right there and it's an easy walk to Sol, Palacio, Gran Via. The receptionists were all friendly and spoke English - which helped. I think we had the best room in the place - there was a little lounge area with a couch, which was nice having some extra space, and there were balconies overlooking the plaza. The shower was tiny, but manageable. Everything was fresh and new. This place was great.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal Gala
HotelInfo.Address: Costanilla de los Angeles 15, 28013 Madrid, Spain
